text: jumpin water droplets have sprung to new
heights thanks to a strange phenomenon
called trampoline II when a water
droplet trampolines
it not only bounces on a completely
rigid surface it gains height with each
leap like a gymnast does on a trampoline
without warning the droplet
spontaneously starts to bounce but
where's the jump start the droplet is
kept in a low pressure environment and
rests on a surface that repels water and
is bumpy on the micro level these bumps
keep the water droplet from making full
contact with the surface key for its
levitation and bounce ability as the
water naturally begins to vaporize
pressure builds below the drop and
essentially launches the water droplet
off the surface because vaporization
also cools water the drop can freeze
making this setup appealing for things
like the icing imagine ice removing
itself one frozen droplet at a time
you
